name: Gold Canyon Golf Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nestled into the flanks of a mountain, the Gold Canyon Golf Resort does not lack for a beautiful natural setting.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Desert Setting

likes.disliked: — Loud heat/air conditioning, dirty looking bathroom floor

reviews.text: The pleasant desk staff person who handled our reservation listened to my request, and chose a private location with a great view.
reviews.title: Golds is as nice as it gets in AZ

likes.disliked: — at the far end of the valley...............................if thats even a problem

reviews.text: Check in was handled quickly and efficiently. A golf cart took us and our luggage to our room, which was a king patio casita in Building 13. Our car was parked quite a distance away from the room.
reviews.title: I go there every year.

reviews.text: Restaurant staff was always warm and polite, service was good, food was OK. The breakfast buffet was rather meager for the price.
reviews.title: Beautiful location, tired resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself had a very nice patio with complete visual privacy except for hapless golfers who ended up in the nearby sand trap. We spent hours watching the rabbits, cactus wrens, hummingbirds, and a bevy of Gambrel's Quail who strutted near the patio every morning and evening.
reviews.title: Smelly Stinky Room
low key atmosphere, comfortable place to kick back
reviews.text: I liked it for what it was: a nice, clean, cheap(at this time of year)getaway with a chance to play golf at two quality golf courses on site and relax a little. The rooms are comfortable and clean. We enjoyed sitting out on the elevated patio in the evenings watching the rabbits and the other wildlife. The small pool area was nothing great, but fit the bill for what we wanted; a place to catch up on some reading and cool off with the occasional dip. Now that I saw the other reviews, I was reminded that the A/C was a bit on the loud side, but after a little while, it was just white background noise. Loved the mountain vistas and those big saguaros.

reviews.title: Beautiful property
reviews.text: One complaint, a typical one for us. The restaurants close way too early. 8:30 pm on the Thursday we arrived and 8:00 pm on Sunday night. I know they consider this offseason, but this is ridiculous. They lost two dinners from us because of this. I wish people would realize that not everyone eats dinner at 6 or 7 o'clock. We are usually still out doing something, taking advantage of the last bit of sunshine the day has to offer. Hope we are not the only ones that feel this way.

We were here on a timeshare exchange the week of Jan 03. Beautiful golf course and area. We had a huge 1 br with our own private hot tub outdoors...2 baths, small kitchen/livingroom combo. Also 2 wet bars. They are in the process of putting in wireless in all the rooms. We had to go to the lobby to use our laptop..no computer available for guests. There is a restaurant and a bar there. We had a terrible waiter on the Monday night discount to owners/Interval guests. But the manager made restitution..Sunday morning the chef prepares 10 omelettes at a time!!!! Highly recommmend! Interval showed laundry facilities available. We were told twice by the front desk that there was a laundry area. The staff didn't seem to be very well informed about things several times. THERE IS NO LAUNDRY. I was told some of the rooms may have washer/dryers. I don't know if that is true or not. Maybe just on the hotel side? We had to have a very important package sent to us there. The delivery of it to us was handled very poorly by the staff. $10 daily fee for maid service that we were not made aware of until our arrival. Overall...a great property, just disappointing staff.
reviews.title: smelly room
Beautiful Resort but noisy room
reviews.text: I booked my timeshare through Interval at the Gold Canyon Resort. My daughter had one studio, and we had another one.

reviews.title: Great resort
reviews.text: There was a scorpion in my daughter's room, which the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great resort. It's close enough to Phoenix but far enough away for peace and quiet. The casitas provide privacy and the private hot tub on the patio was fantastic. The staff was very helpful and kind. We had the breakfast buffet each morning and it was good. They also have made-to-order omelets. My only complaint was about the rooms. There was a chest of drawers with a mini fridge on top. It would be really nice if they had a large piece of furniture with the fridge inside and a microwave. But everything else was perfect! If I make it back to Phoenix I will most definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Lovely views and great staff.

reviews.text: From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty. The staff was warm and friendly. The grounds were immaculate. Our room was clean and had a rustic southwestern feel. We golfed on Sidewinder. A beautiful course. I had a massage at the spa which was one of the best massages I have had. We ate at both the bar and grill and the restaurant. The food was good and Victor our waiter at the restaurant was excellent. Great place to vacation. If we are back in this area again we will stay here.
reviews.title: Loved our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our recent stay 9-23-11 to 9-25-11 was a true delight. We traveled for a couple's weekend from Ohio, and saw a "deal" on Groupon, so decided to take a chance on a resort, as it appeared nice, and were pleasantly delighted. Our casita included a fireplace, whirlpool and giant shower, and although it needed updating, it was clean and spotless with a gorgeous view. Our special included golf for hubby on Dinosaur Mtn course, and a massage for myself. Jamie in the spa was wonderful, and my husband provided me with a 5* review of the course. In addition, breakfast was included with both days, and the restaurant was fantastic! The pool was small, but more than adequate, and this resort offered just what we were looking for -- serenity and quiet! It is a bit off the beaten path, about 25 minutes outside of Phoenix, so I would hope that the golf is the purpose of this destination for most. One of the restauant hosts, Seriena is the gem of this resort. She greets everyone with a smile, and outdoes herself to ensure we had a wonderful stay. She's one of those folks you run across that genuinely loves what she does, and doesn't know her pleasant nature takes guests from liking a resort to loving a resort! When we consider what we paid for this weekend, we are thrilled. We usually stick to tried and true names we know and trust, and were thrilled with this unique, off the beaten path little inn. Bringing the bedding and rooms up to date would create perfection!!!
reviews.title: What a delightful treat, with a wonderful staff!

reviews.text: This was our second visit to GCGR and the resort has declined. Property and golf courses are spectacular. Reservations were fouled up. Paid extra for an upgraded room facing the mountain and GCGR tried to stick us in a room facing the lobby. Probably one of the worst rooms in resort. Housekeeping never cleaned patio or picked up debris on property. The one waitress at the restaurant couldn't handle the 57 golfers wanting breakfast before their tee times. Never improved the three days we were playing golf. If one of the staff did not know the answer to our questions that was the end, no offer to find the answer and get back to us. This is a nice place, it is just missing the something that would make it special. In 2003 it had that something!
reviews.title: Not What it Should Be

reviews.text: I have gone to GCGR since I was a kid! I myself lived only about 20 minutes away if not less. Whenever family would come down from back east we'd go there and other places around Arizona.
reviews.title: Faithful Customer!

reviews.text: I thought the concept and layout of this resort was really neat! The casitas were pretty cool! You basically get your own mini house, although it is connected to other rooms by like one wall it was set up really well. We will stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think the prices are a bit high though. Every staff member we encountered was very nice and I think they really liked working there! That alone tells you a lot about the place.
reviews.title: Disappointment

reviews.text: I do have a few complaints that if the hotel management reads these reviews might make a difference if they do anything about them. It would be nice to have breakfast included with the, what I consider, higher price of the room. Also, the floors in our room made the bottoms of our feet absolutely black and we wiped them off with a washcloth every night before getting into bed. Now, I am not sure if it's because of dirty floors or the color of the black carpet coming off on our feet. Also, there should be some updating done to the bathroom, especially the shower and shower head. The faucets were very noisy to use and I think if they were replaced they wouldn't be heard by other rooms, as we did hear others turing on their sink faucets.
reviews.title: Pampered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, I love that everyone gets a secluded feel as the rooms/casitas are spread out, however, it would be really cool if they would give golf carts for guest use or even have them to check out for a refundable fee as it was a lot of walking. Don't get me wrong, I don't mind the walking, but since we are a family with 2 little ones it takes quite a while to just walk from our room to the pool. I loved the room layout and the little private fireplace! It was also really cool to be able to walk out onto a lawn pretty much of our own. Our kids loved running around on the lawn!
reviews.title: High-end golf price. Cheezy golf experience.

reviews.text: I would stay here again, but I feel the room prices are a bit high and my husband would have golfed but he felt the greens fees were too high priced too.
reviews.title: Wonderful Facility Superior Service

reviews.text: I'm not a golfer so can't comment on the golf experience. I'm only staying here because my husband is attending some business meetings. The grounds are lovely & the landscaping is perfect. The rooms look attractive but we have found them to be very, very noisy & as a result, we getting terrible sleep. The walls are thin; we can hear our neighbors talking; their plumbing is noisy & their pipes knock at 5:30 AM. Plus, the mattresses are 'ordinary' i.e., no pillowtop & the sheets are thin so we awake stiff in the mornings. The hotel is very stingy with soap, skin & hair products.
reviews.title: Disappointed

likes.disliked: — Noisy rooms, poor mattress, dining, remoteness from shopping

reviews.text: We were also very surprised at their regulation which prohibits bringing your own alcohol into your room. Never, never encountered that situation before which forces you into buying what is stocked in the room at an outrageous restocking fee of 20%.
reviews.title: Will not play at Gold Canyon again.

reviews.text: We tried their room service one nite; it was quick but the food was absolutely horrible. The problem is, there is no decent restaurant for miles & miles. The only other restaurants around serve burgers & sandwiches which isn't evening fare.
reviews.title: Recommended
Tweaking is in order!
reviews.text: Fitness centre isn't bad. Only 1 pool & 1 hot tub (except for those rooms that have their own jucuzzi spas).

reviews.title: great course lousy pro shot
reviews.text: I wouldn't go out of my way to stay here again. In fact, I told my husband (& he's the golfer) that we won't be staying any extra nites here & he agrees.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort has small groups of suites that are really mini-apartments called "casitas," The terrain is very hilly, and many of the access roads and footpaths are extremely steep and difficult to navigate; some include many stairs. To make matters worse, there are no signs to tell you which numbered units are located in which buildings or up which paths, and nighttime lighting is very poor. As a result, is it extremely easy to become completely disoriented on the grounds after dark. Parking is in short supply, and most of the units are not particularly close to a parking area. The roads to reach the parking areas are narrow, steep, and winding, allowing barely enough room for one car to pass through. Inside the casitas, furnishings are comfortable but hardly what one would call luxurious. The TVs are very old, and the furniture could do with an updating. The fitness room, which I used once, has no fixed weight machines, only dumbbells and a few cardio machines -- which are also old, and, at least in the case of the machine I used, have burned-out LEDs on their displays. There are no amenities typically found in good hotel fitness rooms, such as free earbuds to listen to TV or music. I do not golf, so I cannot comment on the golf course.
reviews.title: Scale the slopes at Gold Canyon Resort

reviews.text: I am writing to tell you about the terrible stay we had at you resort this past weekend. The 1st night we were there we had dinner in the restaurant and waited 20 minutes at our table before a server even noticed us. Then we proceeded to wait about 20 minutes to get our drinks and another 40 minutes until we were served our food. Our server was nice and kept apologizing but it was still very unprofessional. Then we went back to our room and my husband went in the spa. I was walking around the room barefoot and almost stepped on a Arizona Bark Scorpion. You might have your staff tell the guests it's not a good idea to walk around the room barefoot since you have deadly scorpions in your rooms. (Per GOOGLE: The United States only has one type of scorpion that is considered deadly to humans. The Arizona bark scorpion) My husband was able to catch it and release it. Had we known at the time it was a deadly scorpion we probably wouldn't have done so. When I called the front desk to advise them and ask if we should be concerned I was told "Call us back if you get stung and we'll tell you what to do." REALLY??? Needless to say we didn't sleep well that night. The next night it rained and we spent all night listening to the leak in our ceiling and the very loud guests in the room behind us. (Your walls are like paper) I put the ice bucket under the leak and my husband told me to call the front desk to advise them that we had a leak. I said "Why, knowing this place they will just send a guy with a bigger bucket." and that is exactly what they did. So we stayed in the room to watch the FREE HBO. Did I mention that channel didn't come in? We also ordered room service the 2nd night because we didn't want to wait forever for our meal in the restaurant. It arrived cold! We had guests join us for the "Champagne" Brunch and were never offered champagne. Our room was dirty, my husband got an itchy rash from the spa and as I was searching the room constantly for more scorpions I killed many spiders. I advised the desk man of this when we left and he said "Wow, sorry about that." and continued to charge us full price. Needless to say we will never be staying at your resort again. This is the letter I wrote to the hotel and their response was to credit me $30 of a $433 bill. Needless to say we won't be staying there ever again.
reviews.title: Don't stay here, trust me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort is a golfers paradise. There are two beautiful golf courses surrounding the resort. We asked for a room that overlooked the golf course. Although it is slightly dated they are in the process of updating the rooms. The room we had is basically one huge room with the bed just three steps up from the living area. The room comes with a small fridge. The beds were comfortable. The parking is not close to the rooms so be ready for a walk and it is a bit steep to walk to where the parking is located. There isn't a whole lot to do besides the golf, there is a spa if you choose and a pool. There are not any shops located close to the resort so this is mostly a place that is suited best for a golfing vacation. The breakfast voucher is if you book online you can get a breakfast voucher which will make the breakfast buffet $5.00 instead of $11.00. They will not work with you at all if you did not know of this before and want to buy it after you have checked in. The service at the restaurant and bar & grill is very slow so be patient.
reviews.title: Great place for golfers but get a breakfast voucher!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed two nights at this property, had our son's wedding rehearsal dinner there and most of the wedding guests and wedding attendant's stayed there as well. Dinner started late, food was good but cold, held outside and the heaters were not started by the time our guests arrived. BEAUTIFUL views, golf course outstanding. Parking is very far away from rooms and a lot of walking to return to restaurant, bar and spa. Parking is also limited and rather congested. Bride & Groom's key didn't work when returning after their wedding day, called down to lobby for someone to bring a key, after 15 minutes called AGAIN and waiting another 10 minutes outside in the cold. Rooms were clean and nice with a great private patio and view. Pricey so we were disappointed in SOME of the service because we were expecting better.
reviews.title: Not what we expected

reviews.text: My family and I visited my brother in Arizona May 2011. We stayed at the Gold Canyon Golf Resort. We stayed in a casita with 2 queen beds. Room was very always clean, very quiet. This hotel is a little ways from any major shopping, but getting around in the phoenix area wasn't a challenge with a rental car. This is a very photogenic area. I took a bunch of photos with my dslr, but are too large to upload. I don't golf, but other members of my party do, They said golf was outstanding. this facility has a pool, which looked relatively clean and well kept. It was upper 90's, low 100's during our trip, which was 30-35 degrees warmer than our home town.
reviews.title: Great hotel on golf course
Nice resort for the price
reviews.text: My husband and I just celebrated our anniversary at this resort and we were overall pleased with what we got for the price. We had a room with a private jacuzzi and it was very clean and very private. I do have a few issues with the room. While it was decorated very nice they need to be seriously up dated. The carpet in our room was pulled away from the edges at all the doors, outside and in, not very appleaing to the eye plus it was like indoor outdoor carpet to boot. I loved the set up in the bathroom/dressing room however, there were not electrical outlets. So you were stuck using their small hair dyer and forget plugging in a curling iron. There were no wash clothes to be found in either the bathroom or the dressing room area. The door leading out to the jacuzzi when closed has a decent gap at the top of it and the blinds were very old and actually one broke when we attempted to pull the blinds closed. Our price included two one hour massages, which were excellent just would have enjoyed it more if the rooms were better sound proofed. You could hear the conversations in the rooms next to you but the massage therapist were great! We ate dinner in the sports room, I believe it was called Greenwood. Anyway, we had a beautiful view of the golf course, the service was excellent as was the food. The next morning we ate breakfast at the buffet in Kokopellis and again had another beautiful view of the golf course and the food was outstanding. We enjoyed our 24hrs of peace and quite and would recommend this property to anyone looking for a place to get a away.

reviews.title: Service was Abysmal
reviews.text: I recently attended a wedding and was surprised at the lack of professionalism for such a beautiful resort. It seemed that there were some internal changes that had significantly deteriorated the quality of the resort. The resort did not seem to have the staff in order to give its guests the service they needed in a timely manner. We found ourselves waiting for a bellman on many occasions for literally hours. When we needed towels they came late as well, and when we needed bathroom tissue, it never arrived. In some cases the staff was actually shockingly rude as they became frustrated with not being able to provide service. The most disappointing of all of the experiences at the resort would be the lack of accountability throughout the uppermanagement. There seemed to be nothing but excuses and a lack of professionalism from the top down. It just goes to show that greatness or mediocrity starts at the top.

reviews.title: Great resort
reviews.text: Just spent 4 days at this resort and loved the rooms, golf and the staff, what a hidden jewel I found. Staff went out of their way to make our stay mor pleasant. I you are ever in Az you must look this place up.

reviews.title: Beautiful desert setting
reviews.text: Our family of five, with three kids under the age of 7 stayed here for 5 nights. I was there to run the Lost Dutchman marathon in Jan. Coming from the midwest in winter this place will always be a beautiful memory for all of us. First. the rates are fantastic as the host hotel for the marathon. The room with a patio and outdoor private fireplace with a view to the mountains only yards away was fantastic. The pool was wonderful and big. The food was great. The staff often helped with the kids while we ate. The pictures we have of the desert setting and the views of the sunsets are breathtaking. I can't say one bad thing about the best resort to represent the Arizona desert. There are many things to do in the area and we were away from the big city lights, noise and crowds.

reviews.title: Spectacular Resort!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in September during "off peak" season. We received an unbelievable rate (about 80 per night) The rooms are spacious, clean and the decor is beautiful! We had a large patio with a gorgeous view of the desert and gold coarse. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We would definately stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband took me there for a surprise birthday weekend. I always get my massages at the spa there and LOVE IT. We have stayed there one other time many years ago. I thought the accommodations were dated and old then. This time we had a rather large room with the indoor jacuzzi spa, living room, kitchen area and patio. When we first walked in the old, musty smell hit me. I wanted to open the doors and windows, but it was 105 degrees outside. I did not even want to sit on the furniture because it looked dirty and old. When we went to sleep the sheets didn't fit on the skinny mattress and I was itchy all night long. I could hardly wait to get the heck out of there the next day. Never again! The SURPRISE was on me!!!
reviews.title: RENEW, REMODEL, RENOVATE!!! PLEASE DO ONE OF THE THREE!!!

reviews.text: Stayed on July 15th for a "Stay and Play" and although the grounds are very nice as are the Casitas, the room was less than desirable. The water in the bathroom didn't get hot, the sheets on the bed were stiff, the bed was too hard, and when the air conditioning kicked on, it was so loud it woke us up everytime. I realize for the summer rate it was still a good value since the rate included a round of golf but, I was surprised at the quality of these items at such a nice place.
reviews.title: Golf Great, Ammentities not so much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently dined at the Gold Canyon Golf Resort Restaurant. Our server, Jonathan, was pleasant. To start I ordered a Lemon Drop Martini while my husband ordered a Perfect Manhattan. We sat on the patio enjoying a beautiful view of the desert with the city lights off in the distance. When my Lemon Drop arrived I was disappointed in the presentation and taste. The server had no problem bringing this drink to the table. The glass was just over half full. It looked like a drink someone had previously had a few sips of. The rim of the glass was bare. I expect a Lemon Drop Martini to be served in a martini glass full to its sugared rim and ice cold. Jonathan asked how our drinks were just after being served. The Manhattan was a success but I told Jonathan I did not like the Lemon Drop. My husband asked Jonathon if he would replace my Lemon Drop with a perfect Manhattan and ordered a second one for himself. We ordered the prime rib special. First we were served with an assortment of dinner rolls that were warm and wonderful . My hungry husband decided to order the tortilla soup when he realized the meal did not come with soup or salad. The soup was brought just as dinner was served. He started to send it back but decided to keep it. The soup was excellent. The prime rib came with garlic mashed potatoes and assorted vegetables. My potatoes were served just warm but I had no complaints with the taste of the food. The manager came by to ask how our meal was. We both agreed the food was good. I mentioned my disappointment with the Lemon Drop Martini which still sat on the table. We then shared how much we enjoyed the Manhattan with him. He said "I'm glad we could make a drink right for you." When we received our dinner bill we were both surprised the charge for the Lemon Drop was not removed.
reviews.title: The Restaurant Only

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dont waste your money or your time....
reviews.title: Dont waste your time and money

reviews.text: Good afternoon,
reviews.title: Beautiful resort with cheap motel feel to rooms

description: Gold Canyon Resort’s 85 unique Hotel rooms offer a variety of amenities such as Indoor or Outdoor Private Spas, Suites, Wood Burning Fireplaces and Private Patios with splendid views of the majestic Superstition Mountains. This unique setting provides us with spectacular views of the famed Superstition Mountains where many have attempted to find the Lost Dutchman’s’ gold. Natural wildlife to the area can be encountered right outside your door. Carved out of the foothills of the scenic Superstition Mountains, the 36 holes of Desert Mountain Golf at Gold Canyon offer two distinct playing options. Dinosaur Mountain, rated Four and a Half stars by Golf Digest takes golfers into the high Sonoran Desert with dramatic tee-to-green elevation changes. Sidewinder, Four Star Rating by Golf Digest, runs through the land's natural arroyos and dry creek beds, providing a pristine desert golf experience.Amenities include Hiking, Biking, Swimming Pool, and Jeep Tours, Massage and Spa Services, Fitness Center and much more! Enjoy spectacular views while dining at Kokopelli's Restaurant, The Bar & Grill or The Ledge at Dinosaur Mountain. Over 10,000 feet of Distinct Full Service Meeting and Banquet facilities for functions ranging from 10-200.Located just 35 minutes from Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport, this very special mountainside resort is close enough to the Valley of the Sun, yet far enough away to let you experience the peace and unmatched beauty of the high Sonoran Desert. We strive to create an experience that you will not soon forget. Come and enjoy a true Arizona Golf Resort experience.
